00038 FileRemovalEngine * FileRemovalEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00039 {
00040         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == FileRemovalEngine::EngineName())
00041                 return (FileRemovalEngine *)engine;
00042         return NULL;
00043 }

00045 FileRemovalEngine::FileRemovalEngine() {
00046     defineOptions();
00047 }
00048 
00049 FileRemovalEngine::~FileRemovalEngine() {
00050 }
00051 
00052 void FileRemovalEngine::defineOptions() {
00053         defineOption("", "files-list", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00054                 "Text file specifying files to process, one per line with the first line being 'files'.",
00055                 "");
00056         defOptMult("", "files", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00057                 "The files to process.",
00058                 "");
00059         defineOption("", "delete-listed-files", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00060                 "Should the engine delete the listed files.  This option allows the user to choose.",
00061                 "yes");
00062 }
00063 
00064 void FileRemovalEngine::defineStates() { }
00065 
00066 /**
00067  * Make sure that our options are sane. Call Err::errAbort if not.
00068  */
00069 void FileRemovalEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00070 {
00071     defineStates();
00072 
00073         // Read in list files list from other file if specified.
00074         vector<string> files;
00075         string fileName = getOpt("files-list");
00076         if (fileName.empty() == false)
00077         {
00078                 affx::TsvFile tsv;
00079 #ifdef WIN32
00080                 tsv.m_optEscapeOk = false;
00081 #endif
00082                 string file;
00083                 tsv.bind(0, "file", &file, TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00084                 if(tsv.open(fileName) != TSV_OK) {
00085                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open files file: " + fileName);
00086                 }
00087                 tsv.rewind();
00088                 while(tsv.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00089                         files.push_back(file);
00090                 }
00091                 tsv.close();
00092                 Verbose::out(1, "Read " + ToStr(files.size()) + " files from: " + Fs::basename(fileName));
00093         }
00094         else
00095         {
00096                 files = getOptVector("files");
00097         }
00098         setOpt("files", files);
00099 }
00100 
00101 static vector<string> split(const string &inputString)
00102 {
00103         vector<string> tokens;
00104         size_t substrBegin = 0;
00105         for (;;)
00106         {
00107                 size_t substrEnd = inputString.find ("?", substrBegin);
00108                 if (substrEnd == string::npos)
00109                 {
00110                         // No more '?' - save what's left, quit.
00111                         string subString = inputString.substr (substrBegin);
00112                         // Avoid returning a null string from a terminating '?' or an empty inputString.
00113                         if (! subString.empty())
00114                                 tokens.push_back (subString);
00115                         break;
00116                 }
00117                 // Avoid null strings from an initial '?' or '??'.
00118                 if (substrEnd != substrBegin)
00119                         tokens.push_back (inputString.substr (substrBegin, substrEnd - substrBegin) );
00120                 // Continue following the '?'
00121                 substrBegin = substrEnd + 1;
00122         }
00123         return tokens;
00124 }
00125 
00126 /**
00127    This is the "main()" equivalent of the engine.
00128 */
00129 void FileRemovalEngine::runImp()
00130 {
00131         string delete_listed_files = getOpt("delete-listed-files");
00132 
00133         if (delete_listed_files.empty() == false && (delete_listed_files[0] == 'y' || delete_listed_files[0] == 'Y'))
00134         {
00135                 // Read the input files and delete them.
00136                 vector<string> files = getOptVector("files");
00137                 for (vector<string>::iterator it=files.begin(); it!=files.end(); it++)
00138                 {
00139                         vector<string> tokens = split(*it);
00140                         for (vector<string>::iterator tokenIt=tokens.begin(); tokenIt!=tokens.end(); tokenIt++)
00141                                 Fs::rm(tokenIt->c_str(), false);
00142                 }
00143         }
00144 }
